info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 6:20PM PST until January 03 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 8 inches, mainly north of the Clackamas River. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills above 2000 feet, mainly north of the Clackamas River. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be challenging at times. Gusty winds will cause blowing snow which may reduce visibility at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Slow down and allow extra time when travelling. Practice your winter safety rules. Keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your car in case of emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
